text:
When visit http://www.apache.org/index/ , reture a 404 not found page.
But instead of saying /index/ not found, it says "/index.html/" not found!
Isn't is strange?  It maybe nothing hurt, but in some cases it is really bad.

For example, there is a location in httpd config file:
    <location something/>
        handler...
    </location>
we can access http://domain.name/something/.., without create directory
something in wwwroot.
But if there is a file "wwwroot/something.ext" already exist, we have to create
direcotry "wwwroot/something" before access it.

creator: rahul.g.nair@gmail.com
text:
Couldn't reproduce in trunk |echo "GET /index/ HTTP/1.0\r\n\r\n" | nc 0 8080 HTTP/1.1 404 Not Found Date: Mon, 08 Sep 2008 11:48:17 GMT Server: Apache/2.3.0-dev (Unix) Content-Length: 204 Connection: close Content-Type: text/html; charset=iso-8859-1 404 Not Found

Not Found

The requested URL /index/ was not found on this server.

After adding below in httpd.conf, and no file status.* in htdocs SetHandler server-status |echo "GET /status HTTP/1.0\r\n\r\n" | nc 0 8080 HTTP/1.1 200 OK Date: Mon, 08 Sep 2008 11:51:23 GMT Server: Apache/2.3.0-dev (Unix) Content-Length: 1267 Connection: close Content-Type: text/html; charset=ISO-8859-1 ..... Also be sure location 'something' has a leading slash
